head.title: Paid Notice: Deaths CLAY, MARIE M.

hedline.hl1: Paid Notice: Deaths CLAY, MARIE M.

block.p: CLAY--Marie M., 81, developmental scientist, distin guished literacy researcher, and founder of Reading Recovery, died Friday, April 13, 2007, in New Zealand. Internationally recognized for outstanding research on early literacy learning and credited with changing the face of primary school literacy instruction. Past president of the International Reading Association. First woman professor and first woman to head an academic department at the University of Auckland. Made a Dame Commander of the British Empire in 1987 and named ''New Zealander of the Year'' in 1994. Honors and awards include five honorary degrees and 2005 establishment of the Marie Clay Endowed Chair at The Ohio State University. Memorial Services April 19 at the University of Auckland.
